docs.title: Floowandereeze & Modding - Duel Links Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the documentation for Floowandereeze & Modding - Duel Links, a tool for modding the desktop version of Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links. This documentation will guide you through all the features and capabilities of the application.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
To begin using Floowandereeze & Modding:

  1. Download the application from the Releases tab
  2. Run the .exe file
  3. On first launch, provide the game's path when prompted
  4. The application will automatically download the latest data update
  5. Restart the application to access all features

docs.title: Documentation Sections
docs.text:
Explore the documentation to learn how to use all the features of Floowandereeze & Modding:

  • Configuration - Learn how to configure application settings
  • Card Editor - Customize card art
  • Card Sleeve Editor - Design custom card sleeves
  • Playmat Editor - Create unique playmat textures

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text: If you encounter any issues or have questions about using Floowandereeze & Modding, please check the documentation sections for detailed guides on each feature.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Contributions are welcome! If you find a bug or have a feature request, please open an issue on the GitHub repository.

docs.title: Card Editor
docs.text: The Card Editor page allows you to modify card art and information in Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links. This page provides functionality to view, edit, replace, and manage card assets.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Card list with search functionality
  • Card preview and editing
  • Card art replacement
  • Card texture extraction
  • Backup and restore functionality
  • Auto-complete search suggestions

docs.title: Card List
docs.text:
• Displays all available cards in a thumbnail view
  • Click on a card to select it for editing
  • Shows card names bellow thumbnails

docs.title: Preview Section
docs.text:
• Shows the currently selected card's art
  • Displays the card's bundle information
  • Updates in real-time when changes are made

docs.title: Action Buttons
docs.text:
• Select Image: Choose a new card art image
  • Replace: Apply the selected image to the card
  • Copy: Copy the card bundle to the cards folder
  • Extract: Extract the card's texture
  • Restore: Restore the card from backup
  • Favorite: Mark/unmark the selected card as favorite

docs.title: Search
docs.text:
• Search box with auto-complete suggestions
  • Minimum 3 characters required for search
  • Case-insensitive search
  • Favorites: Filter to show only favorited cards
  • Matches partial text within card names

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
1. Searching Cards

    • Type at least 3 characters in the search box
    • Use auto-complete suggestions for quick selection
    • Check "Favorites" to filter only favorited cards
    • The list will filter to show matching cards after clicking the search button or pressing ENTER

  2. Selecting a Card

    • Click on a card in the list to select it
    • The preview will update to show the selected card
    • Action buttons will become enabled

  3. Replacing Card Art

    • Click "Select Image" to choose a new card art, or drag and drop an image
    • Preview the selected image
    • Click "Replace" to apply the changes
    • A backup will be created if enabled in settings

  4. Managing Backups

    • Select a modified card
    • Click "Restore" to revert to the original version
    • A notification will indicate if backup exists

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The application creates backups automatically if enabled in settings
  • Unity3D cards cannot be copied but can be extracted
  • The search feature requires at least 3 characters to prevent performance issues
  • Pendulum cards are currently not supported due to the complexity of their art
  • Rush Duel cards are currently not supported due to the complexity of their art

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: The Configuration page allows you to manage application settings and perform maintenance tasks in Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links. This page provides functionality to configure game paths, update data, manage backups, and customize the application appearance.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Game path configuration
  • Data update management
  • Backup system configuration
  • Application appearance customization
  • Asset compression settings
  • Mipmap count configuration
  • Bulk backup management

docs.title: Game Path Settings
docs.text:
• Game Path: Set the path to the Duel Links installation, up to the player ID folder
  • Update Button: Check and update app data
  • Version Display: Show current data version

docs.title: Backup Management
docs.text:
• Enable Backups: Toggle automatic backup creation
  • Restore All: Restore all modified assets with backups to their original state
  • Clear Backups: Delete all backup files
  • Restore Text Edits: Revert all text modifications to their original state
  • Reapply Text Edits: Reapply all previously made text modifications

docs.title: Appearance Settings
docs.text:
• Background Image: Set custom application background
  • Reset Background: Remove custom background

docs.title: Asset Settings
docs.text:
• Mipmap Count: Configure texture mipmap levels (Default 10)
  • Compression Options:
  • None
  • LZMA
  • LZ4
  • LZ4HC
  • LZHAM

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
1. Setting Game Path

    • Click "Select Game Folder" to choose Duel Links installation
    • Path is validated before being saved
    • Application restart required after setting path, so assets are updated

  2. Updating Data

    • Set game path first
    • Click "Update" to check for new data
    • Updates are downloaded automatically if available

  3. Managing Backups

    • Toggle "Enable Backups" to control automatic backup creation
    • Use "Restore All" to revert all changes
    • Use "Clear Backups" to remove backup files
    • Use "Restore Text Edits" to revert all text modifications to their original state
    • Use "Reapply Text Edits" to reapply all previously made text modifications

  4. Customizing Appearance

    • Click "Select Background" to choose custom background
    • Use "Reset Background" to remove custom background
    • Changes are applied immediately
    • The app has a dark theme, so bright backgrounds are not recommended

  5. Configuring Asset Settings

    • Set desired mipmap count (default: 10)
    • Choose compression method for new assets
    • Settings affect all new asset replacements

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Game path must be set before using most features
  • Data updates require a valid game path first
  • Backup system affects all asset types
  • Asset settings affect all new replacements
  • Some changes require application restart
  • Backups create local copies of assets, so they take storage space
  • The text edit operations can take a very long time, depending on available resources and amount of cards modified

docs.title: Playmat Editor
docs.text: The Playmat Editor page allows you to modify playmat textures in Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links. This page provides functionality to view, replace, and manage playmat assets.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Playmat list with preview
  • Playmat texture replacement
  • Texture extraction
  • Bundle copying
  • Real-time preview updates

docs.title: Playmat List
docs.text:
• Displays all available playmats
  • Click on a playmat to select it for editing
  • Shows the playmat bundle information

docs.title: Preview Section
docs.text:
• Shows the currently selected playmat
  • Displays the playmat's bundle information
  • Updates in real-time when changes are made

docs.title: Action Buttons
docs.text:
• Select Image: Choose a new playmat texture image
  • Replace: Apply the selected image to the playmat
  • Copy: Copy the playmat bundle to the fields folder
  • Extract: Extract the playmat texture

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
1. Selecting a Playmat

    • Click on a playmat in the list to select it
    • The preview will update to show the selected playmat
    • Action buttons will become enabled

  2. Replacing Playmat Texture

    • Click "Select Image" to choose a new playmat texture
    • Preview the selected image
    • Click "Replace" to apply the changes

  3. Extracting Textures

    • Select a playmat
    • Click "Extract" to save the texture
    • The texture will be saved to the "fields" folder

  4. Copying Playmats

    • Select a playmat
    • Click "Copy" to save the bundle
    • The playmat will be copied to the "fields" folder

docs.title: Card Sleeve Editor
docs.text: The Card Sleeve Editor page allows you to modify card sleeves in Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links. This page provides functionality to view, replace, and customize card sleeves with optional border effects.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Card sleeve list with preview
  • Sleeve texture replacement
  • Texture extraction
  • Border customization
  • Backup and restore functionality
  • Real-time preview updates

docs.title: Card Sleeve List
docs.text:
• Displays all available card sleeves
  • Click on a sleeve to select it for editing

docs.title: Preview Section
docs.text:
• Shows the currently selected card sleeve
  • Displays the selected sleeve's bundle information
  • Updates in real-time when changes are made
  • Supports border preview toggle

docs.title: Action Buttons
docs.text:
• Select Image: Choose a new sleeve texture image
  • Replace: Apply the selected image to the sleeve
  • Copy: Copy the sleeve bundle to the sleeves folder
  • Extract: Extract the sleeve texture
  • Border Color: Choose a color for the sleeve border
  • Restore: Restore the sleeve from backup

docs.title: Border Options
docs.text:
• Checkbox to toggle border
  • Color picker for border customization
  • Border width is set to 15 pixels

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
1. Selecting a Card Sleeve

    • Click on a sleeve in the list to select it
    • The preview will update to show the selected sleeve
    • Action buttons will become enabled

  2. Replacing Sleeve Texture

    • Click "Select Image" to choose a new sleeve texture
    • Preview the selected image
    • Click "Replace" to apply the changes
    • A backup will be created if enabled in settings

  3. Customizing Border

    • Click "Border Color" to choose a color
    • Use the checkbox to toggle border preview
    • The border will be applied when replacing the sleeve

  4. Extracting Textures

    • Select a sleeve
    • Click "Extract" to save the texture
    • The texture will be saved to the "sleeves" folder

  5. Managing Backups

    • Select a modified sleeve
    • Click "Restore" to revert to the original version
    • A notification will indicate if backup exists

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The application creates backups automatically if enabled in settings
  • Border customization is optional and can be toggled on/off
